Module com.example.paint
Package com.example.paint

Class PaintDraw

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
com.example.paint.PaintDraw
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
PaintCanvas
public class PaintDraw extends javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
Malachinski Pain(t) Application - PaintDraw.java This class file is used to manage the tools used to draw on the canvas. All the tool methods and their getters / setters are defined here. INCLUDES JAVADOC COMMENTING

  • Property Summary

    • rectTool

      public void rectTool(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Draws a rectangle to the canvas from the coordinates x1,y1 to x2,y2
      Parameters:
      x1 - - initial x
      y1 - - initial y
      x2 - - final x
      y2 - - final y

    • squareTool

      y1 - - initial y
      x2 - - final x
      y2 - = final y

    • polygonTool

      public void polygonTool(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, int s)
      draws a polygon of s sides to the canvas with a center at x1, y1 and calculates radius with x2, y2.
      Parameters:
      x1 - - x coordinate for center of polygon
      y1 - - y coordinate for center of polygon
      x2 - - x2 coordinate for
      y2 - - y2 coordinate for
      s - - s for desired sides on the polygon

    • triangleTool

      public void triangleTool(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, int s)
      draws a triangle to the canvas of s sides (hard coded to 3) to the canvas with a center at x1, y1 and calculates radius with x2, y2.
      Parameters:
      x1 - - x coordinate for the center of polygon
      y1 - - y coordinate for the center of polygon
      x2 - - x2 coordinate for
      y2 - - y2 coordinate for
      s - - s for desired sides on the polygon

    • getRegion

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getRegion(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      gets the current image on the canvas at coordinates x1,y1 and x2,y2
      Parameters:
      x1 - - x1 is the coordinate starting at the top left of the canvas
      y1 - - y1 is the coordinate starting at the top left of the canvas
      x2 - - x2 is the coordinate ending at the bottom right of the canvas
      y2 - - y2 is the coordinate ending at the bottom right of the canvas
      Returns:
      the image in the specified region
